verses.text: Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left \add us\add* of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short \add of it\add*.
For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard \add it\add*.
For we which have believed do enter into rest, as \add he\add* said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
For \add he\add* spake in a certain place of the seventh \add day\add* on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.
And in this \add place\add* again, If they shall enter into my rest.
Seeing therefore it remaineth that some \add must\add* enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief,
again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.
For if Jesus had given them rest, \add then\add* would he not afterward have spoken of another day.
There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.
For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God \add did\add* from his.
Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any \add man\add* fall after the same example of unbelief.

For the word of God \add is\add* quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and \add is\add* a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
Neither is there any creature \add that is\add* not manifest in his sight: but all \add things are\add* naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast \add our\add* profession.
For we have not a high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all \add points\add* tempted like as \add we are, yet\add* without sin.
Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
